channel.title: Buying a new car
channel.description:
Ok peeps, im looking to purchase a car.
I dont want to spend more than $40,000.
I want a car that looks...awesome. One of those cars that will catch your eye, and one you will remember for weeks to come.
I just like showing off, so looks are the main factor here. Performance needs to be ample, not neccesarily brilliant... ive already lost my license twice for speeding.
So moparians, what kinda car you reckon would be awesome...something you'd only see once every month or year. I DONT LIKE LOOKING LIKE EVERYONE ELSE!!! RARRRR

And this guy is saying his 1.6l 16valve is 330brake? HAHA hes havin ya on.

item.title: Buying a new car
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Ok what you want is something fairly cheap, fast and looking pretty sex right?
So basically you want a lotus, they are amazing for that sort of thing but they arent practical. If you’re a dentist buy a saab. Subaru, you cant go wrong with one unless you are spasticated they dont break. They are fast and they dont look too bad.However the new Imprezza you can only get if you are a fucking retard, and by which i mean you wake up and decide to lick you windows before breakfast, you should then consider that. If you’re not get an older version

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new car
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

belbn:

Can I get some help finding a 69 roadrunner. Doesnt need to be good shape and I dont want to use ebay or some shit site…

Any reason you don’t want to use ebay? It is a perfectly legitimate way to find a car.

Also, to help you out, these are all the same cars:
Plymouth Roadrunner
Plymouth Satellite
Plymouth GTX

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new car
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:41, topic:246920”][quote author=io9 link=topic=325870.msg2557694#msg2557694 date=1228002854]

[quote author=sanga282 link=topic=325870.msg2557282#msg2557282 date=1227981494]

Mustang. They’re pretty (as in good looking), and pretty cheap.
[/quote]You have ot take into account that he’s an AUSfag Being an assie doesn’t help any bit when it comes to cars.
[/quote

What would being an aussie and buying a car have anything to do with each other?

Aussies like to trek everywhere with their bare chest to show their manhood, then wrestly crocodiles and their ass kicked by stingrays
[/quote][/quote]
Brits and aussies are also terrible at quoting.

Whilst American’s are terrible at maintaining an economy.

Being Australian, and buying a car often means a few things:

  1. We will be bush bashing with our mates, while full of piss and in good spirits.
  2. The car has to be tough, as Australian’s have quite a rough life-style compared to that of a British person.
  3. It has to be fast, every Aussie is a speed demon.
  4. It had better cut through field mud in a hurry.

…:D[/quote]
in that case just get a jeep wrangler or a range rover or a truck

[quote=“Wrauld, post:47, topic:246920”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=325870.msg2562333#msg2562333 date=1228198709]
buy a GM they will become history since united states IS NOT bailing GM out.

Actuely, if you watch the news, they have a 2nd chance. They have to send the government what they are doing WITH the bail out money and have to show EVERY SINGLE DOLLAR used, same with ford and chevy. If the government accepts it, they get a bail out.[/quote]
chevy is GM you mean chrysler

Read full topic

item.title: Buying a new car
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“dogs with guns, post:42, topic:246920”]http://www.pontiac.com/byoCustomizeVehicle.do?styleId=297488&year=2009&pvc=208&title=G8&brand=g8&mode=byosummary&optionList=PCQ,PDX&evar10=byo_path_popularconfig

Get a pontiac g8
My parents just bought one and it’s wicked fast.

POWERTRAIN:
*Engine, 6.0L V8 SFI aluminum with Active Fuel Management Engine, 6.0L V8 SFI aluminum with Active Fuel Management

  • Transmission, 6-speed automatic with Driver Shift Control and Sport Mode Transmission, 6-speed automatic with Driver Shift Control and Sport Mode

EXTERIOR:

* Wheels, 19" (48.3 cm) machine-faced aluminum, 5-spoke Wheels, 19" (48.3 cm) machine-faced aluminum, 5-spoke

INTERIOR:

* Seats, front bucket, Sport Seats, front bucket, Sport

* Audio system, AM/FM stereo with 6-disc CD changer and MP3 playback


[/quote]Lucky, that’s awesome!
